62/**************************************************************************/
63
64#define STATE_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('S', 'T', 'T', 'E')
65#define DNS_STATE_VALID(state) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(state, STATE_MAGIC)
66
67/*%
68 * Log level for tracing dynamic update protocol requests.
69 */
70#define LOGLEVEL_PROTOCOL ISC_LOG_INFO
71
72/*%
73 * Log level for low-level debug tracing.
74 */
75#define LOGLEVEL_DEBUG ISC_LOG_DEBUG(8)
76
77/*%
78 * Check an operation for failure. These macros all assume that
79 * the function using them has a 'result' variable and a 'failure'
80 * label.
81 */
82#define CHECK(op) \
83 do { result = (op); \
84 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) goto failure; \
85 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
86
87/*%
88 * Fail unconditionally with result 'code', which must not
89 * be ISC_R_SUCCESS. The reason for failure presumably has
90 * been logged already.
91 *
92 * The test against ISC_R_SUCCESS is there to keep the Solaris compiler
93 * from complaining about "end-of-loop code not reached".
94 */
95
96#define FAIL(code) \
97 do { \
98 result = (code); \
99 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) goto failure; \
100 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
101
102/*%
103 * Fail unconditionally and log as a client error.
104 * The test against ISC_R_SUCCESS is there to keep the Solaris compiler
105 * from complaining about "end-of-loop code not reached".
106 */
107#define FAILC(code, msg) \
108 do { \
109 const char *_what = "failed"; \
110 result = (code); \
111 switch (result) { \
112 case DNS_R_NXDOMAIN: \
113 case DNS_R_YXDOMAIN: \
114 case DNS_R_YXRRSET: \
115 case DNS_R_NXRRSET: \
116 _what = "unsuccessful"; \
117 } \
118 update_log(log, zone, LOGLEVEL_PROTOCOL, \
119 "update %s: %s (%s)", _what, \
120 msg, isc_result_totext(result)); \
121 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) goto failure; \
122 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
123
124#define FAILN(code, name, msg) \
125 do { \
126 const char *_what = "failed"; \
127 result = (code); \
128 switch (result) { \
129 case DNS_R_NXDOMAIN: \
130 case DNS_R_YXDOMAIN: \
131 case DNS_R_YXRRSET: \
132 case DNS_R_NXRRSET: \
133 _what = "unsuccessful"; \
134 } \
135 if (isc_log_wouldlog(dns_lctx, LOGLEVEL_PROTOCOL)) { \
136 char _nbuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE]; \
137 dns_name_format(name, _nbuf, sizeof(_nbuf)); \
138 update_log(log, zone, LOGLEVEL_PROTOCOL, \
139 "update %s: %s: %s (%s)", _what, _nbuf, \
140 msg, isc_result_totext(result)); \
141 } \
142 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) goto failure; \
143 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
144
145#define FAILNT(code, name, type, msg) \
146 do { \
147 const char *_what = "failed"; \
148 result = (code); \
149 switch (result) { \
150 case DNS_R_NXDOMAIN: \
151 case DNS_R_YXDOMAIN: \
152 case DNS_R_YXRRSET: \
153 case DNS_R_NXRRSET: \
154 _what = "unsuccessful"; \
155 } \
156 if (isc_log_wouldlog(dns_lctx, LOGLEVEL_PROTOCOL)) { \
157 char _nbuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE]; \
158 char _tbuf[DNS_RDATATYPE_FORMATSIZE]; \
159 dns_name_format(name, _nbuf, sizeof(_nbuf)); \
160 dns_rdatatype_format(type, _tbuf, sizeof(_tbuf)); \
161 update_log(log, zone, LOGLEVEL_PROTOCOL, \
162 "update %s: %s/%s: %s (%s)", \
163 _what, _nbuf, _tbuf, msg, \
164 isc_result_totext(result)); \
165 } \
166 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) goto failure; \
167 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
168
169/*%
170 * Fail unconditionally and log as a server error.
171 * The test against ISC_R_SUCCESS is there to keep the Solaris compiler
172 * from complaining about "end-of-loop code not reached".
173 */
174#define FAILS(code, msg) \
175 do { \
176 result = (code); \
177 update_log(log, zone, LOGLEVEL_PROTOCOL, \
178 "error: %s: %s", \
179 msg, isc_result_totext(result)); \
180 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) goto failure; \
181 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
182
183/**************************************************************************/
184
185typedef struct rr rr_t;
186
187struct rr {
188 /* dns_name_t name; */
189 uint32_t ttl;
190 dns_rdata_t rdata;
191};
192
193typedef struct update_event update_event_t;
194
195/**************************************************************************/
196
197static void
198update_log(dns_update_log_t *callback, dns_zone_t *zone,
199 int level, const char *fmt, ...) ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(4, 5);
200
201static void
202update_log(dns_update_log_t *callback, dns_zone_t *zone,
203 int level, const char *fmt, ...)
204{
205 va_list ap;
206 char message[4096];
207
208 if (callback == NULL)
209 return;
210
211 if (isc_log_wouldlog(dns_lctx, level) == false)
212 return;
213
214
215 va_start(ap, fmt);
216 vsnprintf(message, sizeof(message), fmt, ap);
217 va_end(ap);
218
219 (callback->func)(callback->arg, zone, level, message);
220}
221
222/*%
223 * Update a single RR in version 'ver' of 'db' and log the
224 * update in 'diff'.
225 *
226 * Ensures:
227 * \li '*tuple' == NULL. Either the tuple is freed, or its
228 * ownership has been transferred to the diff.
229 */
230static isc_result_t
231do_one_tuple(dns_difftuple_t **tuple, dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver,
232 dns_diff_t *diff)
233{
234 dns_diff_t temp_diff;
235 isc_result_t result;
236
237 /*
238 * Create a singleton diff.
239 */
240 dns_diff_init(diff->mctx, &temp_diff);
241 ISC_LIST_APPEND(temp_diff.tuples, *tuple, link);
242
243 /*
244 * Apply it to the database.
245 */
246 result = dns_diff_apply(&temp_diff, db, ver);
247 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(temp_diff.tuples, *tuple, link);
248 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
249 dns_difftuple_free(tuple);
250 return (result);
251 }
252
253 /*
254 * Merge it into the current pending journal entry.
255 */
256 dns_diff_appendminimal(diff, tuple);
257
258 /*
259 * Do not clear temp_diff.
260 */
261 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
262}
263
264static isc_result_t
265update_one_rr(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_diff_t *diff,
266 dns_diffop_t op, dns_name_t *name, dns_ttl_t ttl,
267 dns_rdata_t *rdata)
268{
269 dns_difftuple_t *tuple = NULL;
270 isc_result_t result;
271 result = dns_difftuple_create(diff->mctx, op,
272 name, ttl, rdata, &tuple);
273 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
274 return (result);
275 return (do_one_tuple(&tuple, db, ver, diff));
276}
277
278/**************************************************************************/
279/*
280 * Callback-style iteration over rdatasets and rdatas.
281 *
282 * foreach_rrset() can be used to iterate over the RRsets
283 * of a name and call a callback function with each
284 * one. Similarly, foreach_rr() can be used to iterate
285 * over the individual RRs at name, optionally restricted
286 * to RRs of a given type.
287 *
288 * The callback functions are called "actions" and take
289 * two arguments: a void pointer for passing arbitrary
290 * context information, and a pointer to the current RRset
291 * or RR. By convention, their names end in "_action".
292 */
293
294/*
295 * XXXRTH We might want to make this public somewhere in libdns.
296 */
297
298/*%
299 * Function type for foreach_rrset() iterator actions.
300 */
301typedef isc_result_t rrset_func(void *data, dns_rdataset_t *rrset);
302
303/*%
304 * Function type for foreach_rr() iterator actions.
305 */
306typedef isc_result_t rr_func(void *data, rr_t *rr);
307
308/*%
309 * Internal context struct for foreach_node_rr().
310 */
311typedef struct {
312 rr_func * rr_action;
313 void * rr_action_data;
314} foreach_node_rr_ctx_t;
315
316/*%
317 * Internal helper function for foreach_node_rr().
318 */
319static isc_result_t
320foreach_node_rr_action(void *data, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset) {
321 isc_result_t result;
322 foreach_node_rr_ctx_t *ctx = data;
323 for (result = dns_rdataset_first(rdataset);
324 result == ISC_R_SUCCESS;
325 result = dns_rdataset_next(rdataset))
326 {
327 rr_t rr = { 0, DNS_RDATA_INIT };
328
329 dns_rdataset_current(rdataset, &rr.rdata);
330 rr.ttl = rdataset->ttl;
331 result = (*ctx->rr_action)(ctx->rr_action_data, &rr);
332 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
333 return (result);
334 }
335 if (result != ISC_R_NOMORE)
336 return (result);
337 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
338}
339
340/*%
341 * For each rdataset of 'name' in 'ver' of 'db', call 'action'
342 * with the rdataset and 'action_data' as arguments. If the name
343 * does not exist, do nothing.
344 *
345 * If 'action' returns an error, abort iteration and return the error.
346 */
347static isc_result_t
348foreach_rrset(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name,
349 rrset_func *action, void *action_data)
350{
351 isc_result_t result;
352 dns_dbnode_t *node;
353 dns_rdatasetiter_t *iter;
354
355 node = NULL;
356 result = dns_db_findnode(db, name, false, &node);
357 if (result == ISC_R_NOTFOUND)
358 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
359 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
360 return (result);
361
362 iter = NULL;
363 result = dns_db_allrdatasets(db, node, ver,
364 (isc_stdtime_t) 0, &iter);
365 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
366 goto cleanup_node;
367
368 for (result = dns_rdatasetiter_first(iter);
369 result == ISC_R_SUCCESS;
370 result = dns_rdatasetiter_next(iter))
371 {
372 dns_rdataset_t rdataset;
373
374 dns_rdataset_init(&rdataset);
375 dns_rdatasetiter_current(iter, &rdataset);
376
377 result = (*action)(action_data, &rdataset);
378
379 dns_rdataset_disassociate(&rdataset);
380 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
381 goto cleanup_iterator;
382 }
383 if (result == ISC_R_NOMORE)
384 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
385
386 cleanup_iterator:
387 dns_rdatasetiter_destroy(&iter);
388
389 cleanup_node:
390 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
391
392 return (result);
393}
394
395/*%
396 * For each RR of 'name' in 'ver' of 'db', call 'action'
397 * with the RR and 'action_data' as arguments. If the name
398 * does not exist, do nothing.
399 *
400 * If 'action' returns an error, abort iteration
401 * and return the error.
402 */
403static isc_result_t
404foreach_node_rr(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name,
405 rr_func *rr_action, void *rr_action_data)
406{
407 foreach_node_rr_ctx_t ctx;
408 ctx.rr_action = rr_action;
409 ctx.rr_action_data = rr_action_data;
410 return (foreach_rrset(db, ver, name,
411 foreach_node_rr_action, &ctx));
412}
413
414
415/*%
416 * For each of the RRs specified by 'db', 'ver', 'name', 'type',
417 * (which can be dns_rdatatype_any to match any type), and 'covers', call
418 * 'action' with the RR and 'action_data' as arguments. If the name
419 * does not exist, or if no RRset of the given type exists at the name,
420 * do nothing.
421 *
422 * If 'action' returns an error, abort iteration and return the error.
423 */
424static isc_result_t
425foreach_rr(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name,
426 dns_rdatatype_t type, dns_rdatatype_t covers, rr_func *rr_action,
427 void *rr_action_data)
428{
429
430 isc_result_t result;
431 dns_dbnode_t *node;
432 dns_rdataset_t rdataset;
433
434 if (type == dns_rdatatype_any)
435 return (foreach_node_rr(db, ver, name,
436 rr_action, rr_action_data));
437
438 node = NULL;
439 if (type == dns_rdatatype_nsec3 ||
440 (type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig && covers == dns_rdatatype_nsec3))
441 result = dns_db_findnsec3node(db, name, false, &node);
442 else
443 result = dns_db_findnode(db, name, false, &node);
444 if (result == ISC_R_NOTFOUND)
445 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
446 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
447 return (result);
448
449 dns_rdataset_init(&rdataset);
450 result = dns_db_findrdataset(db, node, ver, type, covers,
451 (isc_stdtime_t) 0, &rdataset, NULL);
452 if (result == ISC_R_NOTFOUND) {
453 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
454 goto cleanup_node;
455 }
456 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
457 goto cleanup_node;
458
459 for (result = dns_rdataset_first(&rdataset);
460 result == ISC_R_SUCCESS;
461 result = dns_rdataset_next(&rdataset))
462 {
463 rr_t rr = { 0, DNS_RDATA_INIT };
464 dns_rdataset_current(&rdataset, &rr.rdata);
465 rr.ttl = rdataset.ttl;
466 result = (*rr_action)(rr_action_data, &rr);
467 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
468 goto cleanup_rdataset;
469 }
470 if (result != ISC_R_NOMORE)
471 goto cleanup_rdataset;
472 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
473
474 cleanup_rdataset:
475 dns_rdataset_disassociate(&rdataset);
476 cleanup_node:
477 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
478
479 return (result);
480}
481
482/**************************************************************************/
483/*
484 * Various tests on the database contents (for prerequisites, etc).
485 */
486
487/*%
488 * Function type for predicate functions that compare a database RR 'db_rr'
489 * against an update RR 'update_rr'.
490 */
491typedef bool rr_predicate(dns_rdata_t *update_rr, dns_rdata_t *db_rr);
492
493/*%
494 * Helper function for rrset_exists().
495 */
496static isc_result_t
497rrset_exists_action(void *data, rr_t *rr) {
498 UNUSED(data);
499 UNUSED(rr);
500 return (ISC_R_EXISTS);
501}
502
503/*%
504 * Utility macro for RR existence checking functions.
505 *
506 * If the variable 'result' has the value ISC_R_EXISTS or
507 * ISC_R_SUCCESS, set *exists to true or false,
508 * respectively, and return success.
509 *
510 * If 'result' has any other value, there was a failure.
511 * Return the failure result code and do not set *exists.
512 *
513 * This would be more readable as "do { if ... } while(0)",
514 * but that form generates tons of warnings on Solaris 2.6.
515 */
516#define RETURN_EXISTENCE_FLAG \
517 return ((result == ISC_R_EXISTS) ? \
518 (*exists = true, ISC_R_SUCCESS) : \
519 ((result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) ? \
520 (*exists = false, ISC_R_SUCCESS) : \
521 result))
522
523/*%
524 * Set '*exists' to true iff an rrset of the given type exists,
525 * to false otherwise.
526 */
527static isc_result_t
528rrset_exists(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name,
529 dns_rdatatype_t type, dns_rdatatype_t covers,
530 bool *exists)
531{
532 isc_result_t result;
533 result = foreach_rr(db, ver, name, type, covers,
534 rrset_exists_action, NULL);
535 RETURN_EXISTENCE_FLAG;
536}
537
538/*%
539 * Set '*visible' to true if the RRset exists and is part of the
540 * visible zone. Otherwise '*visible' is set to false unless a
541 * error occurs.
542 */
543static isc_result_t
544rrset_visible(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name,
545 dns_rdatatype_t type, bool *visible)
546{
547 isc_result_t result;
548 dns_fixedname_t fixed;
549
550 dns_fixedname_init(&fixed);
551 result = dns_db_find(db, name, ver, type, DNS_DBFIND_NOWILD,
552 (isc_stdtime_t) 0, NULL,
553 dns_fixedname_name(&fixed), NULL, NULL);
554 switch (result) {
555 case ISC_R_SUCCESS:
556 *visible = true;
557 break;
558 /*
559 * Glue, obscured, deleted or replaced records.
560 */
561 case DNS_R_DELEGATION:
562 case DNS_R_DNAME:
563 case DNS_R_CNAME:
564 case DNS_R_NXDOMAIN:
565 case DNS_R_NXRRSET:
566 case DNS_R_EMPTYNAME:
567 case DNS_R_COVERINGNSEC:
568 *visible = false;
569 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
570 break;
571 default:
572 *visible = false; /* silence false compiler warning */
573 break;
574 }
575 return (result);
576}
577
578/*%
579 * Context struct and helper function for name_exists().
580 */
581
582static isc_result_t
583name_exists_action(void *data, dns_rdataset_t *rrset) {
584 UNUSED(data);
585 UNUSED(rrset);
586 return (ISC_R_EXISTS);
587}
588
589/*%
590 * Set '*exists' to true iff the given name exists, to false otherwise.
591 */
592static isc_result_t
593name_exists(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name,
594 bool *exists)
595{
596 isc_result_t result;
597 result = foreach_rrset(db, ver, name,
598 name_exists_action, NULL);
599 RETURN_EXISTENCE_FLAG;
600}
601
602/**************************************************************************/
603/*
604 * Checking of "RRset exists (value dependent)" prerequisites.
605 *
606 * In the RFC2136 section 3.2.5, this is the pseudocode involving
607 * a variable called "temp", a mapping of <name, type> tuples to rrsets.
608 *
609 * Here, we represent the "temp" data structure as (non-minimal) "dns_diff_t"
610 * where each tuple has op==DNS_DIFFOP_EXISTS.
611 */
612
613/*%
614 * A comparison function defining the sorting order for the entries
615 * in the "temp" data structure. The major sort key is the owner name,
616 * followed by the type and rdata.
617 */
618static int
619temp_order(const void *av, const void *bv) {
620 dns_difftuple_t const * const *ap = av;
621 dns_difftuple_t const * const *bp = bv;
622 dns_difftuple_t const *a = *ap;
623 dns_difftuple_t const *b = *bp;
624 int r;
625 r = dns_name_compare(&a->name, &b->name);
626 if (r != 0)
627 return (r);
628 r = (b->rdata.type - a->rdata.type);
629 if (r != 0)
630 return (r);
631 r = dns_rdata_casecompare(&a->rdata, &b->rdata);
632 return (r);
633}
634
635/**************************************************************************/
636/*
637 * Conditional deletion of RRs.
638 */
639
640/*%
641 * Context structure for delete_if().
642 */
643
644typedef struct {
645 rr_predicate *predicate;
646 dns_db_t *db;
647 dns_dbversion_t *ver;
648 dns_diff_t *diff;
649 dns_name_t *name;
650 dns_rdata_t *update_rr;
651} conditional_delete_ctx_t;
652
653/*%
654 * Predicate functions for delete_if().
655 */
656
657/*%
658 * Return true always.
659 */
660static bool
661true_p(dns_rdata_t *update_rr, dns_rdata_t *db_rr) {
662 UNUSED(update_rr);
663 UNUSED(db_rr);
664 return (true);
665}
666
667/*%
668 * Return true if the record is a RRSIG.
669 */
670static bool
671rrsig_p(dns_rdata_t *update_rr, dns_rdata_t *db_rr) {
672 UNUSED(update_rr);
673 return ((db_rr->type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig) ?
674 true : false);
675}
676
677/*%
678 * Internal helper function for delete_if().
679 */
680static isc_result_t
681delete_if_action(void *data, rr_t *rr) {
682 conditional_delete_ctx_t *ctx = data;
683 if ((*ctx->predicate)(ctx->update_rr, &rr->rdata)) {
684 isc_result_t result;
685 result = update_one_rr(ctx->db, ctx->ver, ctx->diff,
686 DNS_DIFFOP_DEL, ctx->name,
687 rr->ttl, &rr->rdata);
688 return (result);
689 } else {
690 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
691 }
692}
693
694/*%
695 * Conditionally delete RRs. Apply 'predicate' to the RRs
696 * specified by 'db', 'ver', 'name', and 'type' (which can
697 * be dns_rdatatype_any to match any type). Delete those
698 * RRs for which the predicate returns true, and log the
699 * deletions in 'diff'.
700 */
701static isc_result_t
702delete_if(rr_predicate *predicate, dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver,
703 dns_name_t *name, dns_rdatatype_t type, dns_rdatatype_t covers,
704 dns_rdata_t *update_rr, dns_diff_t *diff)
705{
706 conditional_delete_ctx_t ctx;
707 ctx.predicate = predicate;
708 ctx.db = db;
709 ctx.ver = ver;
710 ctx.diff = diff;
711 ctx.name = name;
712 ctx.update_rr = update_rr;
713 return (foreach_rr(db, ver, name, type, covers,
714 delete_if_action, &ctx));
715}
716
717/**************************************************************************/
718/*
719 * Incremental updating of NSECs and RRSIGs.
720 */
721
722/*%
723 * We abuse the dns_diff_t type to represent a set of domain names
724 * affected by the update.
725 */
726static isc_result_t
727namelist_append_name(dns_diff_t *list, dns_name_t *name) {
728 isc_result_t result;
729 dns_difftuple_t *tuple = NULL;
730 static dns_rdata_t dummy_rdata = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
731
732 CHECK(dns_difftuple_create(list->mctx, DNS_DIFFOP_EXISTS, name, 0,
733 &dummy_rdata, &tuple));
734 dns_diff_append(list, &tuple);
735 failure:
736 return (result);
737}
738
739static isc_result_t
740namelist_append_subdomain(dns_db_t *db, dns_name_t *name, dns_diff_t *affected)
741{
742 isc_result_t result;
743 dns_fixedname_t fixedname;
744 dns_name_t *child;
745 dns_dbiterator_t *dbit = NULL;
746
747 child = dns_fixedname_initname(&fixedname);
748
749 CHECK(dns_db_createiterator(db, DNS_DB_NONSEC3, &dbit));
750
751 for (result = dns_dbiterator_seek(dbit, name);
752 result == ISC_R_SUCCESS;
753 result = dns_dbiterator_next(dbit))
754 {
755 dns_dbnode_t *node = NULL;
756 CHECK(dns_dbiterator_current(dbit, &node, child));
757 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
758 if (! dns_name_issubdomain(child, name))
759 break;
760 CHECK(namelist_append_name(affected, child));
761 }
762 if (result == ISC_R_NOMORE)
763 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
764 failure:
765 if (dbit != NULL)
766 dns_dbiterator_destroy(&dbit);
767 return (result);
768}
769
770
771
772/*%
773 * Helper function for non_nsec_rrset_exists().
774 */
775static isc_result_t
776is_non_nsec_action(void *data, dns_rdataset_t *rrset) {
777 UNUSED(data);
778 if (!(rrset->type == dns_rdatatype_nsec ||
779 rrset->type == dns_rdatatype_nsec3 ||
780 (rrset->type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig &&
781 (rrset->covers == dns_rdatatype_nsec ||
782 rrset->covers == dns_rdatatype_nsec3))))
783 return (ISC_R_EXISTS);
784 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
785}
786
787/*%
788 * Check whether there is an rrset other than a NSEC or RRSIG NSEC,
789 * i.e., anything that justifies the continued existence of a name
790 * after a secure update.
791 *
792 * If such an rrset exists, set '*exists' to true.
793 * Otherwise, set it to false.
794 */
795static isc_result_t
796non_nsec_rrset_exists(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver,
797 dns_name_t *name, bool *exists)
798{
799 isc_result_t result;
800 result = foreach_rrset(db, ver, name, is_non_nsec_action, NULL);
801 RETURN_EXISTENCE_FLAG;
802}
803
804/*%
805 * A comparison function for sorting dns_diff_t:s by name.
806 */
807static int
808name_order(const void *av, const void *bv) {
809 dns_difftuple_t const * const *ap = av;
810 dns_difftuple_t const * const *bp = bv;
811 dns_difftuple_t const *a = *ap;
812 dns_difftuple_t const *b = *bp;
813 return (dns_name_compare(&a->name, &b->name));
814}
815
816static isc_result_t
817uniqify_name_list(dns_diff_t *list) {
818 isc_result_t result;
819 dns_difftuple_t *p, *q;
820
821 CHECK(dns_diff_sort(list, name_order));
822
823 p = ISC_LIST_HEAD(list->tuples);
824 while (p != NULL) {
825 do {
826 q = ISC_LIST_NEXT(p, link);
827 if (q == NULL || ! dns_name_equal(&p->name, &q->name))
828 break;
829 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(list->tuples, q, link);
830 dns_difftuple_free(&q);
831 } while (1);
832 p = ISC_LIST_NEXT(p, link);
833 }
834 failure:
835 return (result);
836}
837
838static isc_result_t
839is_active(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name,
840 bool *flag, bool *cut, bool *unsecure)
841{
842 isc_result_t result;
843 dns_fixedname_t foundname;
844 dns_fixedname_init(&foundname);
845 result = dns_db_find(db, name, ver, dns_rdatatype_any,
846 DNS_DBFIND_GLUEOK | DNS_DBFIND_NOWILD,
847 (isc_stdtime_t) 0, NULL,
848 dns_fixedname_name(&foundname),
849 NULL, NULL);
850 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS || result == DNS_R_EMPTYNAME) {
851 *flag = true;
852 *cut = false;
853 if (unsecure != NULL)
854 *unsecure = false;
855 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
856 } else if (result == DNS_R_ZONECUT) {
857 *flag = true;
858 *cut = true;
859 if (unsecure != NULL) {
860 /*
861 * We are at the zonecut. Check to see if there
862 * is a DS RRset.
863 */
864 if (dns_db_find(db, name, ver, dns_rdatatype_ds, 0,
865 (isc_stdtime_t) 0, NULL,
866 dns_fixedname_name(&foundname),
867 NULL, NULL) == DNS_R_NXRRSET)
868 *unsecure = true;
869 else
870 *unsecure = false;
871 }
872 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
873 } else if (result == DNS_R_GLUE || result == DNS_R_DNAME ||
874 result == DNS_R_DELEGATION || result == DNS_R_NXDOMAIN) {
875 *flag = false;
876 *cut = false;
877 if (unsecure != NULL)
878 *unsecure = false;
879 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
880 } else {
881 /*
882 * Silence compiler.
883 */
884 *flag = false;
885 *cut = false;
886 if (unsecure != NULL)
887 *unsecure = false;
888 return (result);
889 }
890}
891
892/*%
893 * Find the next/previous name that has a NSEC record.
894 * In other words, skip empty database nodes and names that
895 * have had their NSECs removed because they are obscured by
896 * a zone cut.
897 */
898static isc_result_t
899next_active(dns_update_log_t *log, dns_zone_t *zone, dns_db_t *db,
900 dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *oldname, dns_name_t *newname,
901 bool forward)
902{
903 isc_result_t result;
904 dns_dbiterator_t *dbit = NULL;
905 bool has_nsec = false;
906 unsigned int wraps = 0;
907 bool secure = dns_db_issecure(db);
908
909 CHECK(dns_db_createiterator(db, 0, &dbit));
910
911 CHECK(dns_dbiterator_seek(dbit, oldname));
912 do {
913 dns_dbnode_t *node = NULL;
914
915 if (forward)
916 result = dns_dbiterator_next(dbit);
917 else
918 result = dns_dbiterator_prev(dbit);
919 if (result == ISC_R_NOMORE) {
920 /*
921 * Wrap around.
922 */
923 if (forward)
924 CHECK(dns_dbiterator_first(dbit));
925 else
926 CHECK(dns_dbiterator_last(dbit));
927 wraps++;
928 if (wraps == 2) {
929 update_log(log, zone, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
930 "secure zone with no NSECs");
931 result = DNS_R_BADZONE;
932 goto failure;
933 }
934 }
935 CHECK(dns_dbiterator_current(dbit, &node, newname));
936 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
937
938 /*
939 * The iterator may hold the tree lock, and
940 * rrset_exists() calls dns_db_findnode() which
941 * may try to reacquire it. To avoid deadlock
942 * we must pause the iterator first.
943 */
944 CHECK(dns_dbiterator_pause(dbit));
945 if (secure) {
946 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, ver, newname,
947 dns_rdatatype_nsec, 0, &has_nsec));
948 } else {
949 dns_fixedname_t ffound;
950 dns_name_t *found;
951 found = dns_fixedname_initname(&ffound);
952 result = dns_db_find(db, newname, ver,
953 dns_rdatatype_soa,
954 DNS_DBFIND_NOWILD, 0, NULL, found,
955 NULL, NULL);
956 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS ||
957 result == DNS_R_EMPTYNAME ||
958 result == DNS_R_NXRRSET ||
959 result == DNS_R_CNAME ||
960 (result == DNS_R_DELEGATION &&
961 dns_name_equal(newname, found))) {
962 has_nsec = true;
963 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
964 } else if (result != DNS_R_NXDOMAIN)
965 break;
966 }
967 } while (! has_nsec);
968 failure:
969 if (dbit != NULL)
970 dns_dbiterator_destroy(&dbit);
971
972 return (result);
973}
974
975/*%
976 * Add a NSEC record for "name", recording the change in "diff".
977 * The existing NSEC is removed.
978 */
979static isc_result_t
980add_nsec(dns_update_log_t *log, dns_zone_t *zone, dns_db_t *db,
981 dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name, dns_ttl_t nsecttl,
982 dns_diff_t *diff)
983{
984 isc_result_t result;
985 dns_dbnode_t *node = NULL;
986 unsigned char buffer[DNS_NSEC_BUFFERSIZE];
987 dns_rdata_t rdata = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
988 dns_difftuple_t *tuple = NULL;
989 dns_fixedname_t fixedname;
990 dns_name_t *target;
991
992 target = dns_fixedname_initname(&fixedname);
993
994 /*
995 * Find the successor name, aka NSEC target.
996 */
997 CHECK(next_active(log, zone, db, ver, name, target, true));
998
999 /*
1000 * Create the NSEC RDATA.
1001 */
1002 CHECK(dns_db_findnode(db, name, false, &node));
1003 dns_rdata_init(&rdata);
1004 CHECK(dns_nsec_buildrdata(db, ver, node, target, buffer, &rdata));
1005 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
1006
1007 /*
1008 * Delete the old NSEC and record the change.
1009 */
1010 CHECK(delete_if(true_p, db, ver, name, dns_rdatatype_nsec, 0,
1011 NULL, diff));
1012 /*
1013 * Add the new NSEC and record the change.
1014 */
1015 CHECK(dns_difftuple_create(diff->mctx, DNS_DIFFOP_ADD, name,
1016 nsecttl, &rdata, &tuple));
1017 CHECK(do_one_tuple(&tuple, db, ver, diff));
1018 INSIST(tuple == NULL);
1019
1020 failure:
1021 if (node != NULL)
1022 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
1023 return (result);
1024}
1025
1026/*%
1027 * Add a placeholder NSEC record for "name", recording the change in "diff".
1028 */
1029static isc_result_t
1030add_placeholder_nsec(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name,
1031 dns_diff_t *diff)
1032{
1033 isc_result_t result;
1034 dns_difftuple_t *tuple = NULL;
1035 isc_region_t r;
1036 unsigned char data[1] = { 0 }; /* The root domain, no bits. */
1037 dns_rdata_t rdata = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
1038
1039 r.base = data;
1040 r.length = sizeof(data);
1041 dns_rdata_fromregion(&rdata, dns_db_class(db), dns_rdatatype_nsec, &r);
1042 CHECK(dns_difftuple_create(diff->mctx, DNS_DIFFOP_ADD, name, 0,
1043 &rdata, &tuple));
1044 CHECK(do_one_tuple(&tuple, db, ver, diff));
1045 failure:
1046 return (result);
1047}
1048
1049static isc_result_t
1050find_zone_keys(dns_zone_t *zone, dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver,
1051 isc_mem_t *mctx, unsigned int maxkeys,
1052 dst_key_t **keys, unsigned int *nkeys)
1053{
1054 isc_result_t result;
1055 isc_stdtime_t now;
1056 dns_dbnode_t *node = NULL;
1057 const char *directory = dns_zone_getkeydirectory(zone);
1058 CHECK(dns_db_findnode(db, dns_db_origin(db), false, &node));
1059 isc_stdtime_get(&now);
1060 CHECK(dns_dnssec_findzonekeys(db, ver, node, dns_db_origin(db),
1061 directory, now, mctx, maxkeys, keys,
1062 nkeys));
1063 failure:
1064 if (node != NULL)
1065 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
1066 return (result);
1067}
1068
1069/*%
1070 * Add RRSIG records for an RRset, recording the change in "diff".
1071 */
1072static isc_result_t
1073add_sigs(dns_update_log_t *log, dns_zone_t *zone, dns_db_t *db,
1074 dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name, dns_rdatatype_t type,
1075 dns_diff_t *diff, dst_key_t **keys, unsigned int nkeys,
1076 isc_stdtime_t inception, isc_stdtime_t expire,
1077 bool check_ksk, bool keyset_kskonly)
1078{
1079 isc_result_t result;
1080 dns_dbnode_t *node = NULL;
1081 dns_rdataset_t rdataset;
1082 dns_rdata_t sig_rdata = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
1083 isc_buffer_t buffer;
1084 unsigned char data[1024]; /* XXX */
1085 unsigned int i, j;
1086 bool added_sig = false;
1087 isc_mem_t *mctx = diff->mctx;
1088
1089 dns_rdataset_init(&rdataset);
1090 isc_buffer_init(&buffer, data, sizeof(data));
1091
1092 /* Get the rdataset to sign. */
1093 if (type == dns_rdatatype_nsec3)
1094 CHECK(dns_db_findnsec3node(db, name, false, &node));
1095 else
1096 CHECK(dns_db_findnode(db, name, false, &node));
1097 CHECK(dns_db_findrdataset(db, node, ver, type, 0,
1098 (isc_stdtime_t) 0, &rdataset, NULL));
1099 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
1100
1101#define REVOKE(x) ((dst_key_flags(x) & DNS_KEYFLAG_REVOKE) != 0)
1102#define KSK(x) ((dst_key_flags(x) & DNS_KEYFLAG_KSK) != 0)
1103#define ALG(x) dst_key_alg(x)
1104
1105 /*
1106 * If we are honoring KSK flags then we need to check that we
1107 * have both KSK and non-KSK keys that are not revoked per
1108 * algorithm.
1109 */
1110 for (i = 0; i < nkeys; i++) {
1111 bool both = false;
1112
1113 if (!dst_key_isprivate(keys[i]))
1114 continue;
1115 if (dst_key_inactive(keys[i])) /* Should be redundant. */
1116 continue;
1117
1118 if (check_ksk && !REVOKE(keys[i])) {
1119 bool have_ksk, have_nonksk;
1120 if (KSK(keys[i])) {
1121 have_ksk = true;
1122 have_nonksk = false;
1123 } else {
1124 have_ksk = false;
1125 have_nonksk = true;
1126 }
1127 for (j = 0; j < nkeys; j++) {
1128 if (j == i || ALG(keys[i]) != ALG(keys[j]))
1129 continue;
1130 if (!dst_key_isprivate(keys[j]))
1131 continue;
1132 if (dst_key_inactive(keys[j])) /* SBR */
1133 continue;
1134 if (REVOKE(keys[j]))
1135 continue;
1136 if (KSK(keys[j]))
1137 have_ksk = true;
1138 else
1139 have_nonksk = true;
1140 both = have_ksk && have_nonksk;
1141 if (both)
1142 break;
1143 }
1144 }
1145
1146 if (both) {
1147 /*
1148 * CDS and CDNSKEY are signed with KSK (RFC 7344, 4.1).
1149 */
1150 if (type == dns_rdatatype_dnskey ||
1151 type == dns_rdatatype_cdnskey ||
1152 type == dns_rdatatype_cds)
1153 {
1154 if (!KSK(keys[i]) && keyset_kskonly)
1155 continue;
1156 } else if (KSK(keys[i])) {
1157 continue;
1158 }
1159 } else if (REVOKE(keys[i]) && type != dns_rdatatype_dnskey) {
1160 continue;
1161 }
1162
1163 /* Calculate the signature, creating a RRSIG RDATA. */
1164 CHECK(dns_dnssec_sign(name, &rdataset, keys[i],
1165 &inception, &expire,
1166 mctx, &buffer, &sig_rdata));
1167
1168 /* Update the database and journal with the RRSIG. */
1169 /* XXX inefficient - will cause dataset merging */
1170 CHECK(update_one_rr(db, ver, diff, DNS_DIFFOP_ADDRESIGN, name,
1171 rdataset.ttl, &sig_rdata));
1172 dns_rdata_reset(&sig_rdata);
1173 isc_buffer_init(&buffer, data, sizeof(data));
1174 added_sig = true;
1175 }
1176 if (!added_sig) {
1177 update_log(log, zone, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
1178 "found no active private keys, "
1179 "unable to generate any signatures");
1180 result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
1181 }
1182
1183 failure:
1184 if (dns_rdataset_isassociated(&rdataset))
1185 dns_rdataset_disassociate(&rdataset);
1186 if (node != NULL)
1187 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
1188 return (result);
1189}
1190
1191/*
1192 * Delete expired RRsigs and any RRsigs we are about to re-sign.
1193 * See also zone.c:del_sigs().
1194 */
1195static isc_result_t
1196del_keysigs(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name,
1197 dns_diff_t *diff, dst_key_t **keys, unsigned int nkeys)
1198{
1199 isc_result_t result;
1200 dns_dbnode_t *node = NULL;
1201 dns_rdataset_t rdataset;
1202 dns_rdata_t rdata = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
1203 unsigned int i;
1204 dns_rdata_rrsig_t rrsig;
1205 bool found;
1206
1207 dns_rdataset_init(&rdataset);
1208
1209 result = dns_db_findnode(db, name, false, &node);
1210 if (result == ISC_R_NOTFOUND)
1211 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1212 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1213 goto failure;
1214 result = dns_db_findrdataset(db, node, ver, dns_rdatatype_rrsig,
1215 dns_rdatatype_dnskey, (isc_stdtime_t) 0,
1216 &rdataset, NULL);
1217 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
1218
1219 if (result == ISC_R_NOTFOUND)
1220 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1221 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1222 goto failure;
1223
1224 for (result = dns_rdataset_first(&rdataset);
1225 result == ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1226 result = dns_rdataset_next(&rdataset)) {
1227 dns_rdataset_current(&rdataset, &rdata);
1228 result = dns_rdata_tostruct(&rdata, &rrsig, NULL);
1229 RUNTIME_CHECK(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1230 found = false;
1231 for (i = 0; i < nkeys; i++) {
1232 if (rrsig.keyid == dst_key_id(keys[i])) {
1233 found = true;
1234 if (!dst_key_isprivate(keys[i]) &&
1235 !dst_key_inactive(keys[i]))
1236 {
1237 /*
1238 * The re-signing code in zone.c
1239 * will mark this as offline.
1240 * Just skip the record for now.
1241 */
1242 break;
1243 }
1244 result = update_one_rr(db, ver, diff,
1245 DNS_DIFFOP_DEL, name,
1246 rdataset.ttl, &rdata);
1247 break;
1248 }
1249 }
1250 /*
1251 * If there is not a matching DNSKEY then delete the RRSIG.
1252 */
1253 if (!found)
1254 result = update_one_rr(db, ver, diff, DNS_DIFFOP_DEL,
1255 name, rdataset.ttl, &rdata);
1256 dns_rdata_reset(&rdata);
1257 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1258 break;
1259 }
1260 dns_rdataset_disassociate(&rdataset);
1261 if (result == ISC_R_NOMORE)
1262 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1263failure:
1264 if (node != NULL)
1265 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
1266 return (result);
1267}
1268
1269static isc_result_t
1270add_exposed_sigs(dns_update_log_t *log, dns_zone_t *zone, dns_db_t *db,
1271 dns_dbversion_t *ver, dns_name_t *name, bool cut,
1272 dns_diff_t *diff, dst_key_t **keys, unsigned int nkeys,
1273 isc_stdtime_t inception, isc_stdtime_t expire,
1274 bool check_ksk, bool keyset_kskonly,
1275 unsigned int *sigs)
1276{
1277 isc_result_t result;
1278 dns_dbnode_t *node;
1279 dns_rdatasetiter_t *iter;
1280
1281 node = NULL;
1282 result = dns_db_findnode(db, name, false, &node);
1283 if (result == ISC_R_NOTFOUND)
1284 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1285 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1286 return (result);
1287
1288 iter = NULL;
1289 result = dns_db_allrdatasets(db, node, ver,
1290 (isc_stdtime_t) 0, &iter);
1291 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1292 goto cleanup_node;
1293
1294 for (result = dns_rdatasetiter_first(iter);
1295 result == ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1296 result = dns_rdatasetiter_next(iter))
1297 {
1298 dns_rdataset_t rdataset;
1299 dns_rdatatype_t type;
1300 bool flag;
1301
1302 dns_rdataset_init(&rdataset);
1303 dns_rdatasetiter_current(iter, &rdataset);
1304 type = rdataset.type;
1305 dns_rdataset_disassociate(&rdataset);
1306
1307 /*
1308 * We don't need to sign unsigned NSEC records at the cut
1309 * as they are handled elsewhere.
1310 */
1311 if ((type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig) ||
1312 (cut && type != dns_rdatatype_ds))
1313 continue;
1314 result = rrset_exists(db, ver, name, dns_rdatatype_rrsig,
1315 type, &flag);
1316 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1317 goto cleanup_iterator;
1318 if (flag)
1319 continue;;
1320 result = add_sigs(log, zone, db, ver, name, type, diff,
1321 keys, nkeys, inception, expire,
1322 check_ksk, keyset_kskonly);
1323 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1324 goto cleanup_iterator;
1325 (*sigs)++;
1326 }
1327 if (result == ISC_R_NOMORE)
1328 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1329
1330 cleanup_iterator:
1331 dns_rdatasetiter_destroy(&iter);
1332
1333 cleanup_node:
1334 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
1335
1336 return (result);
1337}
1338
1339/*%
1340 * Update RRSIG, NSEC and NSEC3 records affected by an update. The original
1341 * update, including the SOA serial update but excluding the RRSIG & NSEC
1342 * changes, is in "diff" and has already been applied to "newver" of "db".
1343 * The database version prior to the update is "oldver".
1344 *
1345 * The necessary RRSIG, NSEC and NSEC3 changes will be applied to "newver"
1346 * and added (as a minimal diff) to "diff".
1347 *
1348 * The RRSIGs generated will be valid for 'sigvalidityinterval' seconds.
1349 */
1350isc_result_t
1351dns_update_signatures(dns_update_log_t *log, dns_zone_t *zone, dns_db_t *db,
1352 dns_dbversion_t *oldver, dns_dbversion_t *newver,
1353 dns_diff_t *diff, uint32_t sigvalidityinterval)
1354{
1355 return (dns_update_signaturesinc(log, zone, db, oldver, newver, diff,
1356 sigvalidityinterval, NULL));
1357}
1358
1359struct dns_update_state {
1360 unsigned int magic;
1361 dns_diff_t diffnames;
1362 dns_diff_t affected;
1363 dns_diff_t sig_diff;
1364 dns_diff_t nsec_diff;
1365 dns_diff_t nsec_mindiff;
1366 dns_diff_t work;
1367 dst_key_t *zone_keys[DNS_MAXZONEKEYS];
1368 unsigned int nkeys;
1369 isc_stdtime_t inception, expire, keyexpire;
1370 dns_ttl_t nsecttl;
1371 bool check_ksk, keyset_kskonly, build_nsec3;
1372 enum { sign_updates, remove_orphaned, build_chain, process_nsec,
1373 sign_nsec, update_nsec3, process_nsec3, sign_nsec3 } state;
1374};
1375
1376isc_result_t
1377dns_update_signaturesinc(dns_update_log_t *log, dns_zone_t *zone, dns_db_t *db,
1378 dns_dbversion_t *oldver, dns_dbversion_t *newver,
1379 dns_diff_t *diff, uint32_t sigvalidityinterval,
1380 dns_update_state_t **statep)
1381{
1382 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1383 dns_update_state_t mystate, *state;
1384
1385 dns_difftuple_t *t, *next;
1386 bool flag, build_nsec;
1387 unsigned int i;
1388 isc_stdtime_t now;
1389 dns_rdata_soa_t soa;
1390 dns_rdata_t rdata = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
1391 dns_rdataset_t rdataset;
1392 dns_dbnode_t *node = NULL;
1393 bool unsecure;
1394 bool cut;
1395 dns_rdatatype_t privatetype = dns_zone_getprivatetype(zone);
1396 unsigned int sigs = 0;
1397 unsigned int maxsigs = dns_zone_getsignatures(zone);
1398
1399 if (statep == NULL || *statep == NULL) {
1400 if (statep == NULL) {
1401 state = &mystate;
1402 } else {
1403 state = isc_mem_get(diff->mctx, sizeof(*state));
1404 if (state == NULL)
1405 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
1406 }
1407
1408 dns_diff_init(diff->mctx, &state->diffnames);
1409 dns_diff_init(diff->mctx, &state->affected);
1410 dns_diff_init(diff->mctx, &state->sig_diff);
1411 dns_diff_init(diff->mctx, &state->nsec_diff);
1412 dns_diff_init(diff->mctx, &state->nsec_mindiff);
1413 dns_diff_init(diff->mctx, &state->work);
1414 state->nkeys = 0;
1415 state->build_nsec3 = false;
1416
1417 result = find_zone_keys(zone, db, newver, diff->mctx,
1418 DNS_MAXZONEKEYS, state->zone_keys,
1419 &state->nkeys);
1420 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1421 update_log(log, zone, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
1422 "could not get zone keys for secure "
1423 "dynamic update");
1424 goto failure;
1425 }
1426
1427 isc_stdtime_get(&now);
1428 state->inception = now - 3600; /* Allow for some clock skew. */
1429 state->expire = now + sigvalidityinterval;
1430 state->keyexpire = dns_zone_getkeyvalidityinterval(zone);
1431 if (state->keyexpire == 0) {
1432 state->keyexpire = state->expire;
1433 } else {
1434 state->keyexpire += now;
1435 }
1436
1437 /*
1438 * Do we look at the KSK flag on the DNSKEY to determining which
1439 * keys sign which RRsets? First check the zone option then
1440 * check the keys flags to make sure at least one has a ksk set
1441 * and one doesn't.
1442 */
1443 state->check_ksk =
1444 ((dns_zone_getoptions(zone) &
1445 DNS_ZONEOPT_UPDATECHECKKSK) != 0);
1446 state->keyset_kskonly =
1447 ((dns_zone_getoptions(zone) &
1448 DNS_ZONEOPT_DNSKEYKSKONLY) != 0);
1449
1450 /*
1451 * Get the NSEC/NSEC3 TTL from the SOA MINIMUM field.
1452 */
1453 CHECK(dns_db_findnode(db, dns_db_origin(db), false, &node));
1454 dns_rdataset_init(&rdataset);
1455 CHECK(dns_db_findrdataset(db, node, newver, dns_rdatatype_soa,
1456 0, (isc_stdtime_t) 0, &rdataset,
1457 NULL));
1458 CHECK(dns_rdataset_first(&rdataset));
1459 dns_rdataset_current(&rdataset, &rdata);
1460 CHECK(dns_rdata_tostruct(&rdata, &soa, NULL));
1461 state->nsecttl = soa.minimum;
1462 dns_rdataset_disassociate(&rdataset);
1463 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
1464
1465 /*
1466 * Find all RRsets directly affected by the update, and
1467 * update their RRSIGs. Also build a list of names affected
1468 * by the update in "diffnames".
1469 */
1470 CHECK(dns_diff_sort(diff, temp_order));
1471 state->state = sign_updates;
1472 state->magic = STATE_MAGIC;
1473 if (statep != NULL)
1474 *statep = state;
1475 } else {
1476 REQUIRE(DNS_STATE_VALID(*statep));
1477 state = *statep;
1478 }
1479
1480 next_state:
1481 switch (state->state) {
1482 case sign_updates:
1483 t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(diff->tuples);
1484 while (t != NULL) {
1485 dns_name_t *name = &t->name;
1486 /*
1487 * Now "name" is a new, unique name affected by the
1488 * update.
1489 */
1490
1491 CHECK(namelist_append_name(&state->diffnames, name));
1492
1493 while (t != NULL && dns_name_equal(&t->name, name)) {
1494 dns_rdatatype_t type;
1495 type = t->rdata.type;
1496
1497 /*
1498 * Now "name" and "type" denote a new unique
1499 * RRset affected by the update.
1500 */
1501
1502 /* Don't sign RRSIGs. */
1503 if (type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig)
1504 goto skip;
1505
1506 /*
1507 * Delete all old RRSIGs covering this type,
1508 * since they are all invalid when the signed
1509 * RRset has changed. We may not be able to
1510 * recreate all of them - tough.
1511 * Special case changes to the zone's DNSKEY
1512 * records to support offline KSKs.
1513 */
1514 if (type == dns_rdatatype_dnskey)
1515 del_keysigs(db, newver, name,
1516 &state->sig_diff,
1517 state->zone_keys,
1518 state->nkeys);
1519 else
1520 CHECK(delete_if(true_p, db, newver,
1521 name,
1522 dns_rdatatype_rrsig,
1523 type, NULL,
1524 &state->sig_diff));
1525
1526 /*
1527 * If this RRset is still visible after the
1528 * update, add a new signature for it.
1529 */
1530 CHECK(rrset_visible(db, newver, name, type,
1531 &flag));
1532 if (flag) {
1533 isc_stdtime_t exp;
1534 if (type == dns_rdatatype_dnskey ||
1535 type == dns_rdatatype_cdnskey ||
1536 type == dns_rdatatype_cds)
1537 {
1538 exp = state->keyexpire;
1539 } else {
1540 exp = state->expire;
1541 }
1542
1543 CHECK(add_sigs(log, zone, db, newver,
1544 name, type,
1545 &state->sig_diff,
1546 state->zone_keys,
1547 state->nkeys,
1548 state->inception, exp,
1549 state->check_ksk,
1550 state->keyset_kskonly));
1551 sigs++;
1552 }
1553 skip:
1554 /* Skip any other updates to the same RRset. */
1555 while (t != NULL &&
1556 dns_name_equal(&t->name, name) &&
1557 t->rdata.type == type)
1558 {
1559 next = ISC_LIST_NEXT(t, link);
1560 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(diff->tuples, t, link);
1561 ISC_LIST_APPEND(state->work.tuples, t,
1562 link);
1563 t = next;
1564 }
1565 }
1566 if (state != &mystate && sigs > maxsigs)
1567 return (DNS_R_CONTINUE);
1568 }
1569 ISC_LIST_APPENDLIST(diff->tuples, state->work.tuples, link);
1570
1571 update_log(log, zone, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
1572 "updated data signatures");
1573 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1574 case remove_orphaned:
1575 state->state = remove_orphaned;
1576
1577 /* Remove orphaned NSECs and RRSIG NSECs. */
1578 for (t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->diffnames.tuples);
1579 t != NULL;
1580 t = ISC_LIST_NEXT(t, link))
1581 {
1582 CHECK(non_nsec_rrset_exists(db, newver,
1583 &t->name, &flag));
1584 if (!flag) {
1585 CHECK(delete_if(true_p, db, newver, &t->name,
1586 dns_rdatatype_any, 0,
1587 NULL, &state->sig_diff));
1588 }
1589 }
1590 update_log(log, zone, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
1591 "removed any orphaned NSEC records");
1592
1593 /*
1594 * See if we need to build NSEC or NSEC3 chains.
1595 */
1596 CHECK(dns_private_chains(db, newver, privatetype, &build_nsec,
1597 &state->build_nsec3));
1598 if (!build_nsec) {
1599 state->state = update_nsec3;
1600 goto next_state;
1601 }
1602
1603 update_log(log, zone, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
1604 "rebuilding NSEC chain");
1605
1606 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1607 case build_chain:
1608 state->state = build_chain;
1609 /*
1610 * When a name is created or deleted, its predecessor needs to
1611 * have its NSEC updated.
1612 */
1613 for (t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->diffnames.tuples);
1614 t != NULL;
1615 t = ISC_LIST_NEXT(t, link))
1616 {
1617 bool existed, exists;
1618 dns_fixedname_t fixedname;
1619 dns_name_t *prevname;
1620
1621 prevname = dns_fixedname_initname(&fixedname);
1622
1623 if (oldver != NULL)
1624 CHECK(name_exists(db, oldver, &t->name,
1625 &existed));
1626 else
1627 existed = false;
1628 CHECK(name_exists(db, newver, &t->name, &exists));
1629 if (exists == existed)
1630 continue;
1631
1632 /*
1633 * Find the predecessor.
1634 * When names become obscured or unobscured in this
1635 * update transaction, we may find the wrong
1636 * predecessor because the NSECs have not yet been
1637 * updated to reflect the delegation change. This
1638 * should not matter because in this case, the correct
1639 * predecessor is either the delegation node or a
1640 * newly unobscured node, and those nodes are on the
1641 * "affected" list in any case.
1642 */
1643 CHECK(next_active(log, zone, db, newver,
1644 &t->name, prevname, false));
1645 CHECK(namelist_append_name(&state->affected, prevname));
1646 }
1647
1648 /*
1649 * Find names potentially affected by delegation changes
1650 * (obscured by adding an NS or DNAME, or unobscured by
1651 * removing one).
1652 */
1653 for (t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->diffnames.tuples);
1654 t != NULL;
1655 t = ISC_LIST_NEXT(t, link))
1656 {
1657 bool ns_existed, dname_existed;
1658 bool ns_exists, dname_exists;
1659
1660 if (oldver != NULL)
1661 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, oldver, &t->name,
1662 dns_rdatatype_ns, 0,
1663 &ns_existed));
1664 else
1665 ns_existed = false;
1666 if (oldver != NULL)
1667 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, oldver, &t->name,
1668 dns_rdatatype_dname, 0,
1669 &dname_existed));
1670 else
1671 dname_existed = false;
1672 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, newver, &t->name,
1673 dns_rdatatype_ns, 0, &ns_exists));
1674 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, newver, &t->name,
1675 dns_rdatatype_dname, 0,
1676 &dname_exists));
1677 if ((ns_exists || dname_exists) ==
1678 (ns_existed || dname_existed))
1679 continue;
1680 /*
1681 * There was a delegation change. Mark all subdomains
1682 * of t->name as potentially needing a NSEC update.
1683 */
1684 CHECK(namelist_append_subdomain(db, &t->name,
1685 &state->affected));
1686 }
1687 ISC_LIST_APPENDLIST(state->affected.tuples,
1688 state->diffnames.tuples, link);
1689 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(state->diffnames.tuples));
1690
1691 CHECK(uniqify_name_list(&state->affected));
1692
1693 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1694 case process_nsec:
1695 state->state = process_nsec;
1696
1697 /*
1698 * Determine which names should have NSECs, and delete/create
1699 * NSECs to make it so. We don't know the final NSEC targets
1700 * yet, so we just create placeholder NSECs with arbitrary
1701 * contents to indicate that their respective owner names
1702 * should be part of the NSEC chain.
1703 */
1704 while ((t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->affected.tuples)) != NULL) {
1705 bool exists;
1706 dns_name_t *name = &t->name;
1707
1708 CHECK(name_exists(db, newver, name, &exists));
1709 if (! exists)
1710 goto unlink;
1711 CHECK(is_active(db, newver, name, &flag, &cut, NULL));
1712 if (!flag) {
1713 /*
1714 * This name is obscured. Delete any
1715 * existing NSEC record.
1716 */
1717 CHECK(delete_if(true_p, db, newver, name,
1718 dns_rdatatype_nsec, 0,
1719 NULL, &state->nsec_diff));
1720 CHECK(delete_if(rrsig_p, db, newver, name,
1721 dns_rdatatype_any, 0, NULL,
1722 diff));
1723 } else {
1724 /*
1725 * This name is not obscured. It needs to have
1726 * a NSEC unless it is the at the origin, in
1727 * which case it should already exist if there
1728 * is a complete NSEC chain and if there isn't
1729 * a complete NSEC chain we don't want to add
1730 * one as that would signal that there is a
1731 * complete NSEC chain.
1732 */
1733 if (!dns_name_equal(name, dns_db_origin(db))) {
1734 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, newver, name,
1735 dns_rdatatype_nsec,
1736 0, &flag));
1737 if (!flag)
1738 CHECK(add_placeholder_nsec(db,
1739 newver, name, diff));
1740 }
1741 CHECK(add_exposed_sigs(log, zone, db, newver,
1742 name, cut,
1743 &state->sig_diff,
1744 state->zone_keys,
1745 state->nkeys,
1746 state->inception,
1747 state->expire,
1748 state->check_ksk,
1749 state->keyset_kskonly,
1750 &sigs));
1751 }
1752 unlink:
1753 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(state->affected.tuples, t, link);
1754 ISC_LIST_APPEND(state->work.tuples, t, link);
1755 if (state != &mystate && sigs > maxsigs)
1756 return (DNS_R_CONTINUE);
1757 }
1758 ISC_LIST_APPENDLIST(state->affected.tuples,
1759 state->work.tuples, link);
1760
1761 /*
1762 * Now we know which names are part of the NSEC chain.
1763 * Make them all point at their correct targets.
1764 */
1765 for (t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->affected.tuples);
1766 t != NULL;
1767 t = ISC_LIST_NEXT(t, link))
1768 {
1769 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, newver, &t->name,
1770 dns_rdatatype_nsec, 0, &flag));
1771 if (flag) {
1772 /*
1773 * There is a NSEC, but we don't know if it
1774 * is correct. Delete it and create a correct
1775 * one to be sure. If the update was
1776 * unnecessary, the diff minimization
1777 * will take care of eliminating it from the
1778 * journal, IXFRs, etc.
1779 *
1780 * The RRSIG bit should always be set in the
1781 * NSECs we generate, because they will all
1782 * get RRSIG NSECs.
1783 * (XXX what if the zone keys are missing?).
1784 * Because the RRSIG NSECs have not necessarily
1785 * been created yet, the correctness of the
1786 * bit mask relies on the assumption that NSECs
1787 * are only created if there is other data, and
1788 * if there is other data, there are other
1789 * RRSIGs.
1790 */
1791 CHECK(add_nsec(log, zone, db, newver, &t->name,
1792 state->nsecttl,
1793 &state->nsec_diff));
1794 }
1795 }
1796
1797 /*
1798 * Minimize the set of NSEC updates so that we don't
1799 * have to regenerate the RRSIG NSECs for NSECs that were
1800 * replaced with identical ones.
1801 */
1802 while ((t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->nsec_diff.tuples)) != NULL) {
1803 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(state->nsec_diff.tuples, t, link);
1804 dns_diff_appendminimal(&state->nsec_mindiff, &t);
1805 }
1806
1807 update_log(log, zone, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
1808 "signing rebuilt NSEC chain");
1809
1810 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1811 case sign_nsec:
1812 state->state = sign_nsec;
1813 /* Update RRSIG NSECs. */
1814 while ((t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples)) != NULL)
1815 {
1816 if (t->op == DNS_DIFFOP_DEL) {
1817 CHECK(delete_if(true_p, db, newver, &t->name,
1818 dns_rdatatype_rrsig,
1819 dns_rdatatype_nsec,
1820 NULL, &state->sig_diff));
1821 } else if (t->op == DNS_DIFFOP_ADD) {
1822 CHECK(add_sigs(log, zone, db, newver, &t->name,
1823 dns_rdatatype_nsec,
1824 &state->sig_diff,
1825 state->zone_keys, state->nkeys,
1826 state->inception, state->expire,
1827 state->check_ksk,
1828 state->keyset_kskonly));
1829 sigs++;
1830 } else {
1831 INSIST(0);
1832 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
1833 }
1834 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples, t, link);
1835 ISC_LIST_APPEND(state->work.tuples, t, link);
1836 if (state != &mystate && sigs > maxsigs)
1837 return (DNS_R_CONTINUE);
1838 }
1839 ISC_LIST_APPENDLIST(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples,
1840 state->work.tuples, link);
1841 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1842 case update_nsec3:
1843 state->state = update_nsec3;
1844
1845 /* Record our changes for the journal. */
1846 while ((t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->sig_diff.tuples)) != NULL) {
1847 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(state->sig_diff.tuples, t, link);
1848 dns_diff_appendminimal(diff, &t);
1849 }
1850 while ((t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples)) != NULL)
1851 {
1852 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples, t, link);
1853 dns_diff_appendminimal(diff, &t);
1854 }
1855
1856 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(state->sig_diff.tuples));
1857 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(state->nsec_diff.tuples));
1858 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples));
1859
1860 if (!state->build_nsec3) {
1861 update_log(log, zone, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
1862 "no NSEC3 chains to rebuild");
1863 goto failure;
1864 }
1865
1866 update_log(log, zone, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
1867 "rebuilding NSEC3 chains");
1868
1869 dns_diff_clear(&state->diffnames);
1870 dns_diff_clear(&state->affected);
1871
1872 CHECK(dns_diff_sort(diff, temp_order));
1873
1874 /*
1875 * Find names potentially affected by delegation changes
1876 * (obscured by adding an NS or DNAME, or unobscured by
1877 * removing one).
1878 */
1879 t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(diff->tuples);
1880 while (t != NULL) {
1881 dns_name_t *name = &t->name;
1882
1883 bool ns_existed, dname_existed;
1884 bool ns_exists, dname_exists;
1885 bool exists, existed;
1886
1887 if (t->rdata.type == dns_rdatatype_nsec ||
1888 t->rdata.type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig) {
1889 t = ISC_LIST_NEXT(t, link);
1890 continue;
1891 }
1892
1893 CHECK(namelist_append_name(&state->affected, name));
1894
1895 if (oldver != NULL)
1896 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, oldver, name,
1897 dns_rdatatype_ns,
1898 0, &ns_existed));
1899 else
1900 ns_existed = false;
1901 if (oldver != NULL)
1902 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, oldver, name,
1903 dns_rdatatype_dname, 0,
1904 &dname_existed));
1905 else
1906 dname_existed = false;
1907 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, newver, name, dns_rdatatype_ns,
1908 0, &ns_exists));
1909 CHECK(rrset_exists(db, newver, name,
1910 dns_rdatatype_dname, 0,
1911 &dname_exists));
1912
1913 exists = ns_exists || dname_exists;
1914 existed = ns_existed || dname_existed;
1915 if (exists == existed)
1916 goto nextname;
1917 /*
1918 * There was a delegation change. Mark all subdomains
1919 * of t->name as potentially needing a NSEC3 update.
1920 */
1921 CHECK(namelist_append_subdomain(db, name,
1922 &state->affected));
1923
1924 nextname:
1925 while (t != NULL && dns_name_equal(&t->name, name))
1926 t = ISC_LIST_NEXT(t, link);
1927 }
1928
1929 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1930 case process_nsec3:
1931 state->state = process_nsec3;
1932 while ((t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->affected.tuples)) != NULL) {
1933 dns_name_t *name = &t->name;
1934
1935 unsecure = false; /* Silence compiler warning. */
1936 CHECK(is_active(db, newver, name, &flag, &cut,
1937 &unsecure));
1938
1939 if (!flag) {
1940 CHECK(delete_if(rrsig_p, db, newver, name,
1941 dns_rdatatype_any, 0, NULL,
1942 diff));
1943 CHECK(dns_nsec3_delnsec3sx(db, newver, name,
1944 privatetype,
1945 &state->nsec_diff));
1946 } else {
1947 CHECK(add_exposed_sigs(log, zone, db, newver,
1948 name, cut,
1949 &state->sig_diff,
1950 state->zone_keys,
1951 state->nkeys,
1952 state->inception,
1953 state->expire,
1954 state->check_ksk,
1955 state->keyset_kskonly,
1956 &sigs));
1957 CHECK(dns_nsec3_addnsec3sx(db, newver, name,
1958 state->nsecttl,
1959 unsecure,
1960 privatetype,
1961 &state->nsec_diff));
1962 }
1963 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(state->affected.tuples, t, link);
1964 ISC_LIST_APPEND(state->work.tuples, t, link);
1965 if (state != &mystate && sigs > maxsigs)
1966 return (DNS_R_CONTINUE);
1967 }
1968 ISC_LIST_APPENDLIST(state->affected.tuples,
1969 state->work.tuples, link);
1970
1971 /*
1972 * Minimize the set of NSEC3 updates so that we don't
1973 * have to regenerate the RRSIG NSEC3s for NSEC3s that were
1974 * replaced with identical ones.
1975 */
1976 while ((t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->nsec_diff.tuples)) != NULL) {
1977 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(state->nsec_diff.tuples, t, link);
1978 dns_diff_appendminimal(&state->nsec_mindiff, &t);
1979 }
1980
1981 update_log(log, zone, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
1982 "signing rebuilt NSEC3 chain");
1983
1984 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1985 case sign_nsec3:
1986 state->state = sign_nsec3;
1987 /* Update RRSIG NSEC3s. */
1988 while ((t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples)) != NULL)
1989 {
1990 if (t->op == DNS_DIFFOP_DEL) {
1991 CHECK(delete_if(true_p, db, newver, &t->name,
1992 dns_rdatatype_rrsig,
1993 dns_rdatatype_nsec3,
1994 NULL, &state->sig_diff));
1995 } else if (t->op == DNS_DIFFOP_ADD) {
1996 CHECK(add_sigs(log, zone, db, newver, &t->name,
1997 dns_rdatatype_nsec3,
1998 &state->sig_diff,
1999 state->zone_keys,
2000 state->nkeys, state->inception,
2001 state->expire, state->check_ksk,
2002 state->keyset_kskonly));
2003 sigs++;
2004 } else {
2005 INSIST(0);
2006 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
2007 }
2008 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples, t, link);
2009 ISC_LIST_APPEND(state->work.tuples, t, link);
2010 if (state != &mystate && sigs > maxsigs)
2011 return (DNS_R_CONTINUE);
2012 }
2013 ISC_LIST_APPENDLIST(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples,
2014 state->work.tuples, link);
2015
2016 /* Record our changes for the journal. */
2017 while ((t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->sig_diff.tuples)) != NULL) {
2018 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(state->sig_diff.tuples, t, link);
2019 dns_diff_appendminimal(diff, &t);
2020 }
2021 while ((t = ISC_LIST_HEAD(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples)) != NULL)
2022 {
2023 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples, t, link);
2024 dns_diff_appendminimal(diff, &t);
2025 }
2026
2027 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(state->sig_diff.tuples));
2028 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(state->nsec_diff.tuples));
2029 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(state->nsec_mindiff.tuples));
2030 break;
2031 default:
2032 INSIST(0);
2033 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
2034 }
2035
2036 failure:
2037 if (node != NULL) {
2038 dns_db_detachnode(db, &node);
2039 }
2040
2041 dns_diff_clear(&state->sig_diff);
2042 dns_diff_clear(&state->nsec_diff);
2043 dns_diff_clear(&state->nsec_mindiff);
2044
2045 dns_diff_clear(&state->affected);
2046 dns_diff_clear(&state->diffnames);
2047 dns_diff_clear(&state->work);
2048
2049 for (i = 0; i < state->nkeys; i++)
2050 dst_key_free(&state->zone_keys[i]);
2051
2052 if (state != &mystate && state != NULL) {
2053 *statep = NULL;
2054 state->magic = 0;
2055 isc_mem_put(diff->mctx, state, sizeof(*state));
2056 }
2057
2058 return (result);
2059}
2060
2061static isc_stdtime_t
2062epoch_to_yyyymmdd(time_t when) {
2063 struct tm *tm;
2064
2065#if !defined(WIN32)
2066 struct tm tm0;
2067 tm = localtime_r(&when, &tm0);
2068#else
2069 tm = localtime(&when);
2070#endif
2071 return (((tm->tm_year + 1900) * 10000) +
2072 ((tm->tm_mon + 1) * 100) + tm->tm_mday);
2073}
2074
2075uint32_t
2076dns_update_soaserial(uint32_t serial, dns_updatemethod_t method) {
2077 isc_stdtime_t now;
2078 uint32_t new_serial;
2079
2080 switch (method) {
2081 case dns_updatemethod_none:
2082 return (serial);
2083 case dns_updatemethod_unixtime:
2084 isc_stdtime_get(&now);
2085 if (now != 0 && isc_serial_gt(now, serial))
2086 return (now);
2087 break;
2088 case dns_updatemethod_date:
2089 isc_stdtime_get(&now);
2090 new_serial = epoch_to_yyyymmdd((time_t) now) * 100;
2091 if (new_serial != 0 && isc_serial_gt(new_serial, serial))
2092 return (new_serial);
2093 case dns_updatemethod_increment:
2094 break;
2095 }
2096
2097 /* RFC1982 */
2098 serial = (serial + 1) & 0xFFFFFFFF;
2099 if (serial == 0)
2100 serial = 1;
2101
2102 return (serial);
2103}
